result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) .07 and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) .07 and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip M. McGuire Jr. was found guilty of OWI (5th) .07, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $518 Paid in Full from Bond Posted

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
Defendant is entitled to 156 days sentence credit
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Philip M. McGuire in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders: 1 year 9 months WSPrison, 3 years Extended Supervision; $518 fine, Bond to apply, then balance to 15CF2060; DL Revoked 36 months; IID 36 months; Assessment; Deft IS ELIGIBLE for Substance Abuse Program Deft IS NOT ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration Program; Credit to be determined
